newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Dhaka stocks end lower on profit taking.
newsitem.headline: Dhaka stocks end lower on profit taking.

text.p: Dhaka stocks lost more than one percent by the close on Thursday as investors booked profits after a two-session rise, brokers said.

The Dhaka Stock Exchange all share price index closed 16.1 points or 1.04 percent down at 1,523.67 on a turnover of 110.9 million taka. Of 119 traded issues, 77 lost, 40 gained and two remained unchanged.

Brokers, however, said market sentiment was positive following increased credit offers to shares investors, and expected a quick recovery. IDLC rose 685 taka to 5,253 after it offered one-for-one bnous and 35 percent dividend, Beximco Pharma lost 13 to 211.
